CVRP Problem Instance

class problem.cvrp.instance.Cvrp(file_path: Optional[str] = None, file_type: str = 'local')
__drawLegend()

Method to get variable that will enable to draw then the legend on the graph of matplotlib

Parameters

  • customer_node_color (str) – Color of the nodes representing the customers, default to “#8eaaf6” (kind of sky blue) (opt.)

  • depot_node_color (str) – Color of the node representing the depot, default to “#a6f68e” (kind of soft green) (opt.)

  • node_min_size (int) – Minimum size of customers node, default to 250 (opt.)

  • node_max_size (int) – Maximum size of customers node, default to 500 (opt.)

  • node_depot_size (int) – Size of customers node, default to 300 (opt.)

  • fixed_size (bool) – Is the size of nodes fixed or variable in depends of the demand of the customer. If True the size of node will be based on the node_depot_size parameter, default to True (opt.)

  • node_shape (str) – The shape of the node. Specification is as matplotlib.scatter marker, one of “so^>v<dph8”, default to “o” (opt.)

Returns

The nodes in the legend and their labels

Return type

Tuple[List[Line2D], List[str]]

__drawMathPlotLib()

Method to draw a matplotlib figure representing the graph of the cvrp. It will tne be use in method getFigure and showFigure (private)

Parameters

  • show_edge (bool) – Boolean to know if the edge will be shown or not in the graph representation, default to False (opt.)

  • customer_node_color (str) – Color of the nodes representing the customers, default to “#8eaaf6” (kind of sky blue) (opt.)

  • depot_node_color (str) – Color of the node representing the depot, default to “#a6f68e” (kind of soft green) (opt.)

  • with_labels (bool) – Display or not the name of the nodes (node id), default to True (opt.)

  • node_min_size (int) – Minimum size of customers node, default to 250 (opt.)

  • node_max_size (int) – Maximum size of customers node, default to 500 (opt.)

  • node_depot_size (int) – Size of customers node, default to 300 (opt.)

Returns

A tuple with the following data (in that order) : The graph ploted, the layout of the graph, a list of string representing the color

Return type

Tuple[nx.graph, nx.spring_layout, List[str]]

__parseVrp()

Method use to parse the data in .vrp files. Either web or local file, since the argument must be a string

Parameters

data_to_parse – The string of the data file to parse

Raises

  • KeyError – If either DIMENSION, CAPACITY, NODE_COORD_SECTION, DEMAND_SECTION or DEPOT_SECTION are not in the file to parse or have a wrong format

  • IndexOutOfBound – If not all nodes are in both NODE_COORD_SECTION and DEMAND_SECTION. Can also be raised if DEPOT_SECTION is empty.

distanceMatrix()

Method to get the distance matrix of the cvrp instance (node are sorted by their node_id)

Parameters

  • round_distance (bool) – If the distance between nodes should rounded or not, default to False (opt.)

  • precision (int) – Precision of the round, default to 2 (opt.)

Returns

The distance matrix of the instance

Return type

np.matrix

Note

All the distance are round to the nearest int

Note

The diagonal of the matrix is filled with -1

Exemple

>>> dm = cvrp_instance.distanceMatrix()
getCustomerByCustomerNumber()

Method to get any customer (not depot !) by his customer number (the customer number is the number used in cvrp solution file)

Parameters

customer_number_searched (int) – The customer number of the customer searched

Returns

The customer found with the customer number passed in input of the method or None if none customers have been found with the customer number

Return type

CustomerCvrp

Raises

IndexOutOfBound – if the customer number does not exists (customer number higher than the total amout of customers in the instance)

Example

>>> customer = cvrp_instance.getCustomerByCustomerNumber(id_searched=6)
>>> customer.node_id
7
getCustomerById()

Method to get any customer (not depot !) by his node id (the node id is the number used in vrp file)

Parameters

id_searched (int) – The node id of the customer searched

Returns

The customer found with the node id passed in input of the method or None if none customers have been found with the id

Return type

CustomerCvrp

Raises

KeyError – if there’s multiple customer with the same id

Example

>>> customer = cvrp_instance.getCustomerById(id_searched=6)
>>> customer.node_id
6
getCustomerNumberByNodeId()

Method to get the customer number (used in solution of vrp) to node id (used in instance of vrp). It only sort customers by their node id and then return the index of the node id searched.

Parameters

node_id (int) – The node id that we are surching for

Returns

The customer number of the node searched

Return type

int

Raises

ValueError – when the node id either does not exists or is the node id of the depot

Example

>>> customer_num = cvrp_instance.getCustomerNumberByNodeId(node_id=6)
>>> customer_num
5
getFigure()

Method to get a matplotlib figure representing the graph of the cvrp instance that can be include in tkinter windows then

Parameters

  • show_edge (bool) – Boolean to know if the edge will be shown or not in the graph representation, default to False (opt.)

  • customer_node_color (str) – Color of the nodes representing the customers, default to “#8eaaf6” (kind of sky blue) (opt.)

  • depot_node_color (str) – Color of the node representing the depot, default to “#a6f68e” (kind of soft green) (opt.)

  • with_labels (bool) – Display or not the name of the nodes (node id), default to True (opt.)

  • node_min_size (int) – Minimum size of customers node, default to 250 (opt.)

  • node_max_size (int) – Maximum size of customers node, default to 500 (opt.)

  • node_depot_size (int) – Size of customers node, default to 300 (opt.)

  • fixed_size (bool) – Is the size of nodes fixed or variable in depends of the demand of the customer. If True the size of node will be based on the node_depot_size parameter, default to True (opt.)

  • node_shape (str) – The shape of the node. Specification is as matplotlib.scatter marker, one of “so^>v<dph8”, default to “o” (opt.)

  • alpha (float) – The node transparency, default to 1.0 (opt.)

  • legend_fontsize (int) – The fontsize use in the legend, default to 10 (opt.)

  • legend_markerscale (float) – Scale of node in legend compare to the node size in the graph, default to 0.75 (opt.)

  • legend_labelspacing (float) – The vertical space between the legend entries, in font-size units, default to 0.75 (opt.)

  • legend_borderpad (float) – The fractional whitespace inside the legend border, in font-size units, default to 0.75 (opt.)

  • show_legend (bool) – If the legend should be shown or not, default to False (opt.)

  • fig_size (Tuple[int, int]) – Size of the figure

Returns

The graph figure of the cvrp

Return type

plt.figure

Exemple

>>> root = Tk.Tk()
>>> root.wm_title("Graph embedded in TK")
>>> root.wm_protocol('WM_DELETE_WINDOW', root.quit)
>>> figure=cvrp.getFigure()
>>> canvas = FigureCanvasTkAgg(figure, master=root)
>>> canvas.get_tk_widget().pack(side=Tk.TOP, fill=Tk.BOTH, expand=1)
>>> Tk.mainloop()
getNodeById()

Method to get any node (customer + depot) by his node id (the node id is the number used in vrp file)

Parameters

id_searched (int) – The node id of the customer searched

Returns

The node found with the node id passed in input of the method or None if none node have been found with the id

Return type

CustomerCvrp or DepotCvrp

Raises

KeyError – if there’s multiple node with the same id

Example

>>> node = cvrp_instance.getNodeById(id_searched=6)
>>> node.node_id
6
getNodeIdByCustomerNumber()

Method to get the customer node id (used in instance of vrp) to customer number (used in solution of vrp). It only sort customers by their node id and then return the value indexed at customer_number value

Parameters

customer_number (int) – The customer number that we are surching for

Returns

The node id of the customer searched

Return type

int

Raises

IndexError – when the customer number does not exists

Example

>>> node_id = cvrp_instance.getNodeIdByCustomerNumber(node_id=5)
>>> node_id
6
graph()

Method to get the graph (complete graph) generated with networkx

Returns

The graph of the cvrp instance

Return type

nx.Graph

Note

All the distance are round to the nearest int

Exemple

>>> g = cvrp_instance.graph()
minVehiculeNumber()

Method to get the minimum number of vehicule to make a solution of this cvrp problem

Returns

The minimum number of vehicule to solve the cvrp

Return type

int

Raises

RuntimeError – If there’s no feasible solution (if a demand of at least on customer is higher than the capacity of vehicules)

Exemple

>>> vehicule = cvrp.min_vehicule_number()
>>> vehicule
5
randomInstance()

Method to create a random instance of cvrp

Parameters

  • nb_customer (int) – The number of customers in the instance, default to 30 (opt.)

  • vehicule_capacity (int) – The capacity of the vehicule’s fleet, default to 100 (opt.)

  • customer_demand_lb (int) – Lowerbound of the customer demand which will be distributed randomly and uniformely, default to 1 (opt.)

  • customer_demand_ub (int) – Upperbound of the customer demand which will be distributed randomly and uniformely, default to 20 (opt.)

  • grid_size – The size of the grid in other word the maximum value

Returns

Itself

Return type

Cvrp

Exemple

>>> cvrp.randomInstance(nb_customer=50, vehicule_capacity=100, customer_demand_lb=10, customer_demand_ub=90, grid_size=1000)
readInstanceVrp()

Method to read instance of vrp on local machine

Parameters

file_path – Path of the file where the vrp instance is

Returns

Itself

Return type

Cvrp

Raises

  • FileNotFoundError – when the file has not been found

  • ValueError – when the instance could not have been parsed

Warning

Please ensure the format of the instance is correct. Exemples of the file format can be found on: http://vrp.atd-lab.inf.puc-rio.br/index.php/en/

Exemple

>>> cvrp_instance.readInstanceVrp(file_path="C:\Users\YourName\Documents\instance.vrp")
readInstanceVrpWeb()

Method to read instance of vrp on internet

Parameters

url (str) – Url of the page where the vrp instance is

Returns

Itself

Return type

Cvrp

Raises

  • AssertionError – when the requests failled to get data from the url

  • ValueError – when the instance could not have been parsed

Warning

If the url is incorrect raise a ValueError

Warning

Please ensure the format of the instance is correct. Exemples of the file format can be found on: http://vrp.atd-lab.inf.puc-rio.br/index.php/en/

Exemple

>>> cvrp_instance.readInstanceVrpWeb(url="http://vrp.atd-lab.inf.puc-rio.br/media/com_vrp/instances/P/P-n16-k8.vrp")
showConsole()

Method to display the cvrp instance in the console

showFigure()

Method to display a matplotlib representing the graph of the cvrp instance

Parameters

  • show_edge (bool) – Boolean to know if the edge will be shown or not in the graph representation, default to False (opt.)

  • customer_node_color (str) – Color of the nodes representing the customers, default to “#8eaaf6” (kind of sky blue) (opt.)

  • depot_node_color (str) – Color of the node representing the depot, default to “#a6f68e” (kind of soft green) (opt.)

  • with_labels (bool) – Display or not the name of the nodes (node id), default to True (opt.)

  • node_min_size (int) – Minimum size of customers node, default to 250 (opt.)

  • node_max_size (int) – Maximum size of customers node, default to 500 (opt.)

  • node_depot_size (int) – Size of customers node, default to 300 (opt.)

  • fixed_size (bool) – Is the size of nodes fixed or variable in depends of the demand of the customer. If True the size of node will be based on the node_depot_size parameter, default to True (opt.)

  • node_shape (str) – The shape of the node. Specification is as matplotlib.scatter marker, one of “so^>v<dph8”, default to “o” (opt.)

  • alpha (float) – The node transparency, default to 1.0 (opt.)

  • legend_fontsize (int) – The fontsize use in the legend, default to 10 (opt.)

  • legend_markerscale (float) – Scale of node in legend compare to the node size in the graph, default to 0.75 (opt.)

  • legend_labelspacing (float) – The vertical space between the legend entries, in font-size units, default to 0.75 (opt.)

  • legend_borderpad (float) – The fractional whitespace inside the legend border, in font-size units, default to 0.75 (opt.)

  • show_legend (bool) – If the legend should be shown or not, default to False (opt.)

Exemple

>>> cvrp.showFigure(show_edge=False, customer_node_color="#91faf6")
writeInstanceVrp(file_path: str) → None
